column1: It is also my considered view that in such situations, the person who files the
revision application must plead as to the reasons why he did not or could not
avail himself of such statutorily available remedy.
As pointed out correctly by the learned State Counsel, the petitioner has failed
to provide any reasons in that regard in his petition filed before this Court.
It is also settled law that any person who comes before this Court seeking the
discretionary remedy of revision must establish sufficient exceptional grounds,
